data.text:
2019-20 Cardinal Ambrozic CSS Orientation Day Parent Presentation

Acknowledgment • We would like to acknowledge that we are on sacred indigenous territory and thank the Mississauga’s of the New Credit First Nation for being stewards of this land.

Prayer “Christ has no body on earth but yours, No hands but yours, No feet but yours. Yours are the feet with which He goes about doing good, And yours are the hands with which He is to bless us now.” -St. Teresa of Avila

Welcome • Goal: to provide you with additional information regarding • School Procedures • School Activities and Opportunities for Students • Initiatives that occur within the school • Student Leadership Opportunities • Supports Available

Guidance and Career Education • CAREER RESOURCE CENTRE • EDUCATIONAL PLANNING • SOCIAL AND PERSONAL CONCERNS • TRANSCRIPT / RECORDS

Support Staff - Guidance • Guidance Counsellor: • Mr. A. Frickleton A – Dha • Guidance Counsellor: • Ms. L Tardella Dhi - I • Guidance Counsellor: • Ms. T. Pacheco J - O • Guidance Counsellor: • Ms. M. Andreopoulos P - Z

Additional Support Staff • Student Success Teacher(s): • Ms. L Tardella and Ms. C. Venier • Academic Resource Department Head: • Mr. J. D’Ippolito • Child and Youth Worker: • Ms. F. Till • Social Worker: • Mr. M. Fullan • Psychologist: • Ms. K. Holleran

Vice Principals • Mr. V. Angaran • A - K • Ms. D. Speranza • L - Z

School Schedule

School Schedule

School Schedule School Hours: 8:45 a.m. – 2:45 p.m. School Buses Depart at 2:55 p.m. There are many after school activities within which students can be involved. To be in the school after 3:30pm – students are required to be part of a supervised activity.

Uniform Combination Item Female Male Golf Shir t – Long Required Required McCarthy's sleeve or short sleeve Full Zip Sweat Shirt – McCarthy's This item is optional throughout Optional Optional the year and can be worn over the golf shirt Khaki Pants Required Required McCarthy's School Black/Brown Belt with S olid Black Closed Toe, Closed Dress or Running Shoes Required Required Heel without any non - black trim, logo or laces. Cardinal Ambrozic S.S. Uniform

Uniform • September 25 is the first Spirit Wear Day • Tuck Shop – Students can Purchase Spirit Wear

Safe and Accepting Schools --------------------------------------------------------------------------------Safe, Caring and Inclusive Schools • Catholic Code of Conduct • Bullying Prevention • Responsible use of PED’s and social media • CASTLE – • Catholic Community Culture and Caring Action Team

Student Absence • In the event of any absence please: • Notify the Attendance Office at 905-913-2989 before 9:00 a.m. on the day of the absence; provide the student's name, grade and reason for the absence • Alternative: Student may bring a note the following day and bring to attendance. • Students that arrive after 9:15 am must report to attendance upon arrival to sign in.

Sign-Out Procedures • A student who must leave school during the day must have a parent call the morning of and/or submit a dated and signed note from the parent / guardian to the Attendance Secretary before the beginning of the school day.

Take Your Kid to Work Day • TYKTWD is on November 6th • Mandatory day for all Grade 9’s in Ontario • Students will bring home appropriate forms, must be signed and returned

Assessment and Evaluation • Growing Success – Ministry • Course Outlines are provided by each teacher outlining the Assessment and Evaluation breakdown for each course • Student Agenda includes the Assessment and Evaluation Policies

Assessment and Evaluation • Early Progress Reports – October 7th-11th • Parent Teacher Interviews – October 24th 6:00 p.m.- 9:00 p.m. • Mid -Term Report Cards Go Home – November 21st • Semester 1 Final Exams – January 22nd-28th

Transportation • Busses – STOPR – Greater than 3.8km from the school • Information available at www.STOPR.ca • Picking up students – Please use correct laneways when picking up students after school • Brampton Transit

Lockers • Each student will be given their own Locker • Students are to purchase locks from Cardinal Ambrozic • Students are encouraged to have an extra lock to use when taking phys-ed

Learning Commons – (Library) • START Space • Computer Lab • Printing • Book Resources

School Website and Twitter (cont.) • Follow us on Twitter @CardinalAmbro • Source of Information (New & Upcoming Events, Important News, Bus/School Cancellations, Achievements, Daily Life at Cardinal Ambrozic, Celebrations, etc)

Other School Twitter Handles • Brave Team - @CABraveTeam • Ambrozic Dance - @AmbroDance • AmbroReads (English & Library) - @AmbroReads • Ambrozic Math9 @AmbrozicMath9 • Ambro Sports - @AmbrozicSports • AmbrozicFashion - @AmbrozicFashion • Ambrozic A-Team - @ambroateam • Ambrozic Drama - @AmbrozicDrama • Ambro Social Justice - @AmbroCASA • AmbrozicChapliancy- @ChampliancyAmbro

#AmbroArt

Athletics • Fall – Winter – Spring Seasons • Try-outs are advertised via Morning Announcements and TV Monitors on Cardinal Avenue

Cardinal Ambrozic School Council • If you are interested in being part of the Cardinal Ambrozic Catholic School Council, please complete the attached form and return to the main office by Monday, September 23rd. Please note that self-nomination is an option. • First Meeting September 23rd @ 6:30pm.

Health Communities Initiative

How we eat and move… • 35% of student in Peel (aged 12-18) are physically inactive during leisure time • 15% of Grade 7-12 students in Peel report eating vegetables and fruit at least five times daily • 69% of Peel students consume sugar-sweetened beverages at least once per week

Diabetes rates Rates of diabetes in Peel are higher than the GTA and the Province as a whole. • Type 2 diabetes prevalence rates per 100 people • Peel Region = 9.98 • Brampton = 11.46 • Mississauga = 9.46 • Caledon = 7.67 • Greater Toronto Area = 9.04 • Ontario = 8.28

Did you know? • Without intervention, diabetes rates in Peel are expected to rise from 1/10(2007) to 1/6(2027) • In Peel, type 2 diabetes rates are highest in Brampton, particularly in the northeast

A prescription for CHANGE 5 or more servings of vegetables and fruit per day 5-2-1-0 Our vision is... a prescription for change Mobilize Brampton to address type 2 diabetes by empowering the community to make healthier eating and active lifestyle changes. 2 hours or less of screen time per day 1 hour of physical activity per day 0 sugar-sweetened beverages

myBlueprint Learning Objectives: • Importance of knowing your child and parent involvement • What is myBlueprint? • What you can do as a parent/guardian to stay informed - Sign up for a myBlueprint family account

The Importance of Knowing your child

BRAVE • Brampton River Hawks Against Violence Everywhere • Anti-Bullying Week • Mental Health Awareness Week • Awareness Campaigns • Guest Speakers • 2 Hours Less Screen Time – 5210 Campaign

Phys Ed. Leadership • Terry Fox Run – September 25th • Intramural Tournaments • “1 Hour Physical Activity” – 5210 Campaign

Diversity Team • Black History Month • CaraCardinal – Last week in February
